answerText: Ziegler-Natta catalysts [10] Ziegler-Natta catalysts catalyze the production of these kinds of compounds, which consist of repeating units and are made by step-growth and chain-growth mechanisms. They typically constitute plastics.
heading: NASAT  |2014 | 16 | 21 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: These compounds are produced from the reaction of alkylaluminum with titanium tri or tetrachloride. For 10 points each:  [10] Name these catalysts that can link up terminal alkenes such as propylene, and confer tacticity on the product.
